text: New York University researchersÃ¢ÂÂ have successfully regrown hair on damaged mice skin, as per a study published in the journal Nature Communications. The scientists observed hair growth within four weeks in the mice. They activated a certain brain pathway to spark communication among cells that secrete the protein collagen responsible for maintaining the shape and strength of skin and hair.
summary: शोधकर्ताओं ने चूहों की क्षतिग्रस्त त्वचा पर सफलतापूर्वक बाल उगाये

text: The Supreme Court on Thursday told the Uttar Pradesh government that the vision document on the Taj Mahal, being prepared by the School of Planning and Architecture (SPA), Delhi should be made public. "There is nothing secret about it," the court said. The SPA is preparing a vision document for the protection and preservation of the Taj Mahal.
summary: ताज, SC से लेकर UP सरकार तक के विज़न डॉक्यूमेंट के बारे में कुछ भी गुप्त नहीं है

text: As many as 52 students at Shaikh-Ul-Hind Maulana Mahmood Hasan Medical College in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur have been suspended from class for one month for ragging their juniors. They were suspended after an anti-ragging committee found that the complaints against them were true. The 2016-2017 batch students had beaten up and cut the hair of their juniors.
summary: यूपी कॉलेज में 52 छात्रों को रैगिंग के आरोप में निलंबित किया गया

text: A local English council's decision to allow a jailed Pakistani-origin rapist to meet the survivor's child has sparked a row. The survivor claimed her rapist Arshid Hussain was offered the option to apply "parental rights" over her child. She has called for changes to the Children Act to "ensure rapists can't gain access to children conceived through rape and abuse".

text: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko has urged the NATO to deploy naval ships to the Sea of Azov amid a standoff with Russia "in order to assist Ukraine and provide security". Russia "wants nothing less than to occupy the sea", Poroshenko said. The standoff began after Russia seized three Ukrainian ships and captured over 20 Ukrainian sailors last week.
summary: यूक्रेन ने नाटो को रूस के साथ गतिरोध के बीच जहाजों को तैनात करने के लिए कहा

text: Engineering conglomerate L&T's Group Chairman AM Naik was on Wednesday appointed the Chairman of National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC). NSDC oversees government's short-term skill development programmes including the Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY). It had been functioning without a full-time Chairman since the resignation of the previous Chairman S Ramadorai in November 2016.
summary: एलएंडटी के अध्यक्ष एएम नाइक राष्ट्रीय कौशल विकास निगम के प्रमुख हैं

text: #LetTheTravelBegin campaign is OYO's way of welcoming the winter travel season for its guests. Providing them quality-assured living spaces across the length and breadth of the country, OYO is offering 50% discount on hotel bookings and up to Ã¢ÂÂ¹250 cashback via Paytm to guests. Whether traveling towards winter or away from it, you can find a space anywhere with OYO.
summary: OYO और पेटीएम एक साथ 'यात्रा शुरू करने दो'

text: The Maharashtra assembly has unanimously approved 16% reservation for the Maratha community in jobs and educational institutes. Following this, the total reservation in the state for OBC, SC/ST groups, other minor social groups, and the Marathas will be 68%. Earlier, CM Devendra Fadnavis had hinted at possible reservation, saying, "prepare to celebrate on December 1."
summary: महाराष्ट्र ने 16% मराठा कोटा को मंजूरी दी; 68% सीटें अब आरक्षित

text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on Thursday successfully launched India's Hyperspectral Imaging Satellite (HySIS) along with 30 micro and nanosatellites of eight other countries after a 16-hour countdown. HySIS will help in monitoring pollution from industries, according to ISRO. It will also have other applications in agriculture, forestry, geology, coastal zone study and inland water studies.
summary: ISRO ने 8 देशों के 30 उपग्रहों के साथ भारत का HySIS लॉन्च किया

text: Former Services' medium-pacer Joginder Rao picked up two hat-tricks in a single innings against Northern Punjab in a Ranji match on November 29, 1963. Rao is the only Indian cricketer in first-class history to take two hat-tricks in one innings. He also remains the only cricketer to take three hat-tricks in his first two matches, including one on his debut.
summary: भारतीय गेंदबाज ने एक बार एक ही पारी में 2 हैट्रिक ली

text: A thief who stole a university student's laptop in UK's Birmingham, later sent an e-mail to him apologising for the theft. "I am extremely poor...I left your phone and wallet so I hope that slightly makes up for something," the thief wrote. The e-mail was shared online by the student's flatmate, which has gone viral on the internet.
summary: चोर छात्र का लैपटॉप चुराता है, उसे ई-मेल के जरिए माफी भेजता है

text: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap took to Instagram to reveal that she has been diagnosed with stage 1A cancer. "I'll be going through 12 sessions of chemotherapy. 6 down, and another 6 left," she added. Tahira further wrote, "This post is dedicated to my journey where half the battle is won and the other half I want to fight."
summary: आयुष्मान खुराना की पत्नी ताहिरा ने स्टेज 1 ए कैंसर का निदान किया

text: Rajinikanth and Akshay Kumar starrer '2.0', which released today, "is a cinematic marvel which has...style as well as... substance," wrote Bollywood Hungama. India Today said "the film turns predictable post intermission". It is a "fully fledged package having a good looking body and a soul,"n wrote Koimoi. It has been rated 4.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama), 3/5 (India Today) and 4/5 (Koimoi).
summary: रजनीकांत, अक्षय कुमार अभिनीत फिल्म '2.0' सिनेमाघरों में हिट हुई

text: The BJP has alleged that names of Rohingya Muslims have been added to voters' list in poll-bound Telangana, despite directions from Home Ministry that they aren't Indian citizens. It accused the caretaker TRS government, Congress and AIMIM of deleting the names of genuine voters. A delegation comprising Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi urged the Election Commission to initiate a probe.
summary: बीजेपी का आरोप है कि रोहिंग्याओं के नाम मतदाताओं की सूची में शामिल हैं

text: Reacting to the allegations levelled against her by India Women coach Ramesh Powar, Mithali Raj tweeted it was the darkest day of her life as her patriotism has been doubted. She added that all her hard work in last 20 years of playing for India went in vain. Powar had accused Mithali of chasing "own milestones" during Women's World T20.
summary: मेरी देशभक्ति पर संदेह हुआ, व्यर्थ में 20 साल की मेहनत: मिताली राज

text: Veteran all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took 29 balls to get off the mark for Punjab against Delhi in his first Ranji Trophy innings after 408 days. The 36-year-old went on to score 24 runs off 88 balls, including 4 fours, in the innings. Yuvraj had last played a Ranji Trophy match in October last year, scoring 62 runs in two innings.
summary: युवराज ने 408 दिनों के बाद पहली रणजी खेल में 29 वीं गेंद पर खाता खोला

text: A 55-year-old Assistant Commissioner of Police, Prem Ballabh, allegedly committed suicide on Thursday by jumping from the 10th floor of the Delhi Police headquarters. The ACP's body was found on the porch of the building, near its entrance. The police is investigating the matter and the cause behind the alleged suicide is yet to be ascertained.
summary: दिल्ली ACP ने मुख्यालय की 10 वीं मंजिल से कूदकर आत्महत्या कर ली

text: Over 1,000 policemen will be deployed in Delhi on Thursday as thousands of farmers are expected to march into the capital for a 2-day protest demanding a special three-week Parliament session to discuss the agrarian crisis. While the Delhi Police expects a gathering of 12,000-15,000, the protest organisers said they expect 40,000 farmers to march to Parliament Street on Friday.n
summary: किसानों ने विरोध के लिए राजधानी में मार्च किया, दिल्ली अलर्ट पर

text: The Supreme Court has allowed candidates aged above 25 to take National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) 2019. However, it said their admission would be subject to the final outcome of the case on validity of CBSE's decision to fix upper age limit. It further directed National Testing Agency to extend the deadline for filling NEET form by one week.
summary: SC, 25 से ऊपर के उम्मीदवारों को NEET 2019 के लिए उपस्थित होने की अनुमति देता है

text: President Ram Nath Kovind has appointed Arvind Saxena as the new chairman of Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), which conducts examinations to select diplomats, bureaucrats and police officers. The 1978-batch Indian Postal Service officer was serving as acting chairman since June and had joined the UPSC as a member in 2015. He was earlier Director of the Aviation Research Centre.

text: A picture shared by the Indian Army, showing an Army officer consoling the grieving father of Lance Naik Nazir Ahmad Wani, who lost his life fighting terrorists in Jammu & Kashmir, has gone viral. text: While hearing an ongoing case on delays in prison reforms on Thursday, the Supreme Court said, "You (Centre) don't perform your job but you always criticise judiciary for delay in justice." The court observed that delays in receiving forensic reports, as a large number of posts in forensic labs are lying vacant, forced criminal cases to drag on for years.

text: The Mumbai Police on Wednesday deported six members of UK-based parkour group, Storror, days after a video showing them performing stunts on rooftops of residential buildings in Mumbai went viral. text: A jury in California rejected claims that Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) discriminated against local Americans. text: The government on Wednesday released revised GDP data for the seven years from 2004-05 to 2011-12 under a new base year. The new back series data showed growth at 8.5% in 2010-11 compared to the estimate of 10.3% under the old series. Congress leader and ex-Finance Minister P Chidambaram said the revised GDP numbers are "worse than a bad joke".

text: While campaigning in poll-bound Telangana, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday alleged that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has broken every promise he had made. text: Hunter Shamatt, a 20-year-old who lost his wallet on a Las Vegas-bound flight, was returned his wallet by a stranger with a handwritten note and extra cash to celebrate getting the wallet back. text: Praising Pakistan PM Imran Khan at the Kartarpur corridor groundbreaking ceremony on Wednesday, Punjab Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu said that history will remember Khan for bringing India and Pakistan together. text: Amazon on Tuesday introduced an artificial intelligence-based cloud service called Amazon Comprehend Medical that extracts key data from medical records. text: Antarctica's horseshoe-shaped Deception Island was formed by a volcanic eruption on the continent around 4,000 years ago, according to a study. text: An international team of astronomers claims to have discovered a new dwarf galaxy located 130,000 light-years away from the Milky Way. text: YouTube on Tuesday announced that it will remove all existing pop-up annotations in videos starting January 15, 2019. text: Stating that PM Narendra Modi has already received Pakistan's invite for the SAARC summit, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj said, "Unless and until Pakistan stops terrorist activities in India, there'll be no dialogue, and we'll not participate in SAARC." text: Delhi High Court on Wednesday upheld the conviction of 88 people accused of rioting in East Delhi's Trilokpuri area by a lower court. text: Comedian Kapil Sharma has revealed his girlfriend Ginni Chatrath's family had initially rejected his marriage proposal for Ginni and added, "Inke papaji ne bade pyaar se bola, 'Shut up'." text: After Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra mocked Sreesanth by commenting 'Epic' with a laughing emoticon on a video showing Sreesanth crying on 'Bigg Boss 12' over his match-fixing scandal, his wife Bhuvneshwari has criticised him. text: In their manifesto for the upcoming Rajasthan Assembly elections, BJP has stated that using the word 'Gorakh Dhanda' to describe unethical practices will be made a punishable offence if it's voted to power. text: A government hospital's doctor in Gujarat's Botad district was arrested after he performed a 22-year-old woman's delivery when he was drunk, resulting in the death of both the woman and her newborn child. text: Moody's has downgraded Yes Bank's ratings to non-investment grade and changed outlook to negative citing corporate governance concerns. The resignations, when seen in conjunction with RBI's directive to restrict the term of CEO Rana Kapoor, have raised concerns over corporate governance, Moody's said.

text: While addressing a rally, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday accused the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) government of ruining the Telangana state. text: Rajasthan Congress chief Sachin Pilot on Tuesday criticised the BJP saying it is not the job of a political party or a government to make or break churches, temples and gurdwaras. text: Tamil Nadu Police has banned officials below the rank of sub-inspector from using mobile phones while on an important duty. text: The Peruvian government has banned all mining activity in the Rainbow Mountain tourist area for 12 months. text: Jailed former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has been barred from contesting the upcoming general elections. text: A glitch in the Google Search showed women's hostels, paying guest options and even girls' schools on searching for 'bitches near me'. text: After Congress leader Vilas Muttemwar's 'while everyone knows Rahul Gandhi's father's name, nobody knows who PM Narendra Modi's father was' remark, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley shared a Facebook post titled 'What was the Name of Sardar Patel's Father'. text: A video has surfaced online, wherein a mob can be seen pulling a man out of a police van in Uttar Pradesh and beating him to death as policemen present there just watch. text: Pakistan will invite Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) Summit, as per local media reports quoting Pakistan's Foreign Affairs Ministry. text: Great-granddaughter of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose and Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) leader, Rajashree Choudhury, on Monday, said that the ABHM will contest 2019 Lok Sabha elections independently. text: University of Texas researchers have discovered over 20 new species of deep-sea microbes that consume hydrocarbons such as methane to survive and grow. text: Three US service members were killed on Tuesday in Afghanistan's Ghazni province in an attack claimed by the Taliban militant group. At least 11 US service members have been killed in Afghanistan this year, according to reports.

text: Robbers stole computers from the Pakistan High Commission in Bangladesh following which Pakistan lodged a "strong protest" with the Bangladeshi authorities, Pakistan's Foreign Office said. text: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Instagram to announce that he will get married to his girlfriend Ginni Chatrath on December 12. text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma on Monday said it will buy Japan's Pola Pharma for around $1 million (Ã¢ÂÂ¹7 crore). The Japanese drugmaker specializes in dermatology products and Sun Pharma aims to strengthen its global presence in dermatology sector with this acquisition. The Dilip Shanghvi-led firm entered Japan market in 2016 with the acquisition of 14 brands from Switzerland-based Novartis.

text: America's Brianna Cry reunited with her childhood friend Heidi Tran after 12 years through Twitter. "Hey twitter, I met this girl on a dinner cruise in Hawaii in 2006...I need y'all to help me find my bestfriend," Brianna tweeted and posted a picture of them. "Heard you were looking for me," Brianna's friend replied to her within 12 hours.

text: American reality television personality Kim Kardashian has revealed she was high on ecstasy when she had her first wedding in 2000 and made her 2003 sex tape featuring her then-boyfriend Ray J. "I did ecstasy once and I got married. I did it again, I made a sex tape," she said. Kim added "everything bad" happened when she was high.

text: All-rounder Krunal Pandya has revealed that his brother Hardik Pandya made fun of him when he conceded 55 runs in the first T20I against Australia. "Hardik and I don't talk much about cricket. He was joking and laughing that I went for so many runs. I also joke when he plays poorly. That's all we talk about cricket," he added.
summary: जब मैंने टी 20 आई में 55 बनाम आस: क्रुनाल दिया तो हार्दिक ने मेरा मजाक उड़ाया

text: As many as 12 out of 30 deliveries that Sri Lankan spinner Lakshan Sandakan bowled in the first session of the third day of third Sri Lanka-England Test were no-balls, Sky Sports has found. However, only two of those were noticed by the umpires. "I'd like to see the third umpire call [no-balls]," England vice-captain Jos Buttler said.
summary: SL गेंदबाज 1 सत्र में 12 नो-बॉल देता है, अंपायर सिर्फ 2 नोटिस करते हैं

text: Recalling the then Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf's admiration of ex-India captain MS Dhoni during India's 2006 tour of Pakistan, ex-captain Sourav Ganguly said, "I still remember Pervez Musharraf asking me from 'where did you get him?'" "I told him he was walking near the Wagah border and we pulled him in," Ganguly joked. Ganguly further said Dhoni's a phenomenal cricketer.
summary: वाघा बॉर्डर के पास धोनी मिला: गांगुली ने मुशर्रफ से मजाक में कहा था

text: Pakistani leg-spinner Yasir Shah has become the first bowler since ex-India captain Anil Kumble in 1999 to take 10 wickets in a day in a Test. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after taking eight wickets in the first innings and two in the second against New Zealand on Monday. Shah is also the first Pakistani bowler to achieve the feat.
summary: 1999 में कुंबले के बाद से पाक के शाह ने एक दिन में 10 विकेट लिए

text: The Ministry of Human Resource Development has instructed all states and Union Territories to create guidelines to regulate teaching, wherein it has asked them to follow a 'no homework policy' for class 1 and 2 students. It further asked for regulation of weight of school bags. The Ministry added students shouldn't be asked to bring additional books and extra materials.
summary: कक्षा 1 और 2 के छात्रों के लिए कोई होमवर्क नहीं: स्कूलों के लिए सरकार

text: Mohammed Farooq Shaikh, an accused in the 2002 Akshardham temple attack, was arrested by the Ahmedabad Crime Branch from Ahmedabad Airport on Monday. Two militants with alleged links to Pakistan-headquartered Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) had attacked the Akshardham temple in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on September 24, 2002. Over 30 people were killed and 80 were injured in the attack.
summary: 2002 अहमदाबाद एयरपोर्ट पर अक्षरधाम मंदिर हमले के आरोपी गिरफ्तार

text: Mumbai's 26/11 attacker Ajmal Kasab lied to the court that he had come to India to see Amitabh Bachchan's bungalow, the attack's investigating officer Ramesh Mahale said. Kasab claimed he was outside Bachchan's bungalow when agents of the Research and Analysis Wing detained him and tore his visa and passport. However, CCTV footage clearly showed AK 47-armed Kasab at CST.

text: The Centre has given sanction to the CBI to prosecute veteran Congress leader and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the Ã¢ÂÂ¹3,500-crore Aircel-Maxis case. Chidambaram and his son Karti have been charged with money laundering, under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act by the Enforcement Directorate. Out of 18 accused, sanctions against five former government servants are awaited.
summary: एयरसेल-मैक्सिस मामले में चिदंबरम के खिलाफ मुकदमा चलाने के लिए सरकार को बाध्य करें: सी.बी.आई.

text: Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan lifted a boy on-stage after he was called up to accept the Player of the Series trophy after the third India-Australia T20I on Sunday. Dhawan, who then did his 'Gabbar celebration' in response to the cheering spectators, said, "I enjoy entertaining people and it's all about entertainment out there...both the teams played good cricket."

text: Hollywood actor Will Smith posted a video in which Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton is seen tied to a chair while Smith, dressed in the Mercedes driving attire similar to Hamilton's, is seen getting ready to race. In the video, Smith is seen saying, "I'm sorry, I'm sorry Lewis" to which Hamilton replies, "It's not cool."
summary: विल स्मिथ दौड़ से पहले एफ 1 चालक के अपहरण का वीडियो पोस्ट करते हैं

text: Members of the English cricket team paid tribute to Peter Marples, a member of the England cricket team's travelling fan group 'Barmy Army' who passed away in Sri Lanka during the third Test. The Barmy Army were also seen singing 'Jerusalem' in honour of Marples, who passed away aged 61. England went on to win the third Test.

text: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel and McLaren's Fernando Alonso, who share 11 F1 titles between them, performed the 'synchronised doughnut' celebration after the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. text: Facebook disbanded its 'war room' within two months of launch in favour of a strategic response team, a company spokesperson has said. The 'war room' was launched to quickly spot and fix issues like misinformation during the US midterm elections.

text: Ohio will become the first US state to accept payment of taxes by businesses in Bitcoin, beginning this week. Businesses can pay 23 different taxes with Bitcoin, from employee withholding tax to fuel and sales tax, through an online cryptocurrency portal. Businesses that operate and pay taxes in the state will be eligible to register on the portal.

text: The government has reportedly proposed up to seven years in jail without bail for people who share child pornography on chat apps like WhatsApp. The proposed rules also make it mandatory for anyone who gets a child porn video to report it to the authorities. Further, failure to alert authorities about the video will result in hefty fines.
summary: व्हाट्सएप पर चाइल्ड पोर्न शेयर करने के लिए 7yr जेल का प्रस्ताव: रिपोर्ट

text: The Ministry of Civil Aviation has said it is reviewing private carriers IndiGo and SpiceJet's decision to levy a fee on web check-ins. "(Passengers) can reserve any free seat available at the time of web check-in or will... be assigned seats at the time of airport check-in," it said. "The pricing is only for advance selection of seats... (to) reserve the seat of their choice," the airline added.
summary: हमारी वेब चेक-इन नीति में कोई परिवर्तन नहीं है: IndiGo

text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday claimed the AAP government in Delhi did "much more" than what Prime Minister Narendra Modi did in Gujarat during his tenure as CM. "The people of Delhi are proud of their honest chief minister," he said. He said the AAP's political revolution against corruption and communalism is going on despite obstacles.
summary: गुजरात में पीएम के मुकाबले सीएम के रूप में मेरा प्रदर्शन बेहतर: केजरीवाल

text: Online classifieds platform OLX India on Monday announced the offline expansion of its used-car business in a joint venture with GermanyÃ¢ÂÂs Frontier Car Group (FCG). text: The Chinese hospital which allegedly approved the experiment to create world's first gene-edited babies has denied any links to the same. The scientist who claims to have done the experiment said his goal was to create HIV-resistant children.

text: NASA is preparing to land its $1-billion InSight Mars probe today in what it calls "seven minutes of terror". The probe is expected to enter the Martian atmosphere at 19,800 kmph before an array of 12 thrusters attempts to slow it down to 8 kmph for a safe touchdown. text: Scientists are planning to conduct a study in Antarctica, where they will collect blue whale poop and examine its impact on biodiversity and climate change. They will first deploy sonar buoys to identify the location of the whales and use drones to collect the orange plumes. "I want to show that whales are ecosystem engineers," one of the researchers said.

text: Three children, aged 2-10 years, were killed in Anjaw district of Arunachal Pradesh on Saturday when a live bomb they assumed was a toy exploded accidentally. text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday unveiled a 70-foot-tall statue of Lord Buddha in Bihar's Rajgir. The statue has been installed above a 16-metre radius pedestal in the middle of the lake Ghora Katora. "No petrol...diesel vehicles will be allowed to ply here...only electronic vehicles will ply here," he said. Ghora Katora lake is a historical place, he added.

text: Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said Pakistan is spreading terror in the country. "Pakistan should be ashamed of the bloodshed (it is responsible for). I condemn the killing of innocents by Pakistan," he added. Warning the Pakistan Army chief he said, "you will not be allowed to enter here (Punjab) and vitiate the atmosphere".
summary: देश में आतंक फैला रहा पाकिस्तान: अमरिंदर सिंह

text: Celebrating its 4 year partnership with Amazon, OnePlus has announced various offers on the OnePlus 6T. Further, existing OnePlus as well as Apple users can avail upto Ã¢ÂÂ¹3000 discount if they upgrade to OnePlus 6T.

text: Chinese scientist He Jiankui has claimed he created the world's first genetically-edited babies, a set of twin girls born this month, whose DNA he said he altered. He altered embryos for seven couples during fertility treatments, with one pregnancy resulting thus far. Jiankui said his goal was to put the ability to resist possible future infection with HIV into newborns.

text: Sreesanth, in an episode of Bigg Boss 12, revealed he tried to kill himself six-seven times after being banned from cricket over his involvement in spot-fixing. "If my kids play cricket, I can't even go to the ground to watch," he said after breaking down. "My father was destroyed and mother went into depression all because of me," he added.

text: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said it is a "lame, masculine and stupid thing" to say "there's no proof" when women share their #MeToo stories. "Every woman, who has a voice, has to be respected...for coming out there," he added. Karan further said post the #MeToo movement, there is a "huge sense of accountability" that has set in.

text: Pakistan reduced New Zealand from 50/0 in 21.3 overs to 90/10 in 35.3 overs in the first innings in the second Test in Dubai on Monday. As many as six New Zealand batsmen were bowled out for ducks, the joint-most ducks in an innings in Test history. Pakistan spinner Yasir Shah finished with bowling figures of 12.3-1-41-8.

text: Mitsubishi Motors on Monday said its board removed Carlos Ghosn from his role as Chairman, following his arrest and ouster from alliance partner Nissan last week for alleged financial misconduct. Mitsubishi CEO Osamu Masuko will become temporary chairman, the automaker said. Nissan removed Ghosn as Chairman after allegations of understating his income and using company money for personal use.

text: On the 10th anniversary of 26/11 Mumbai attacks, Meghalaya Governor Tathagata Roy on Monday said many people, "except Muslims", were killed during the terror attacks. However, he retracted his statement and apologised after facing criticism. "I was misinformed of the Paki-sponsored killers...having spared Muslims...Several Muslims were killed. It was a mistake of facts," he wrote in a now-deleted tweet.
summary: मेघालय गुव का कहना है कि 26/11 हमले में मुसलमान नहीं मारे गए, माफी मांगते हैं

text: The HRD Ministry instructed all states and Union Territories the maximum weight of school bags for Class 1 and 2 students can't exceed 1.5 kg. For Classes 3 to 5, the limit is 2-3 kg and it's 4 kg for Classes 6 and 7. For Classes 8 and 9, the limit is 4.5 kg, and 5 kg for Class 10.
summary: भारत भर में स्कूल बैग के लिए सरकार द्वारा निर्धारित वजन सीमा क्या है?

text: Punjab minister Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Sunday pasted a black tape on his name, along with names of CM Captain Amarinder Singh and his colleagues, on the foundation stone that was to be laid for Kartarpur corridor. "I did this in protest against Parkash and Sukhbir Badal's names on stone. Why is their name here?...it's not BJP-Akali event," Randhawa said.

text: During an encounter in Kashmir's Awantipora, the Army killed one Pakistani-origin terrorist and captured alive a Kashmiri local, Sohail Lone, who had joined Jaish-e-Mohammed four months back. "His mother and sisters had appealed him to come back. We promised his mother that we will not kill him and despite him firing at us, we...apprehended him alive," Colonel Samar Raghav said.

text: Sandra Samuel, the nanny who saved the then two-year-old Moshe Holtzberg during the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, has revealed Moshe is still afraid of darkness. "He doesn't say anything. But in the night he wants all lights on. He can't sleep even in a dim light," she added. Moshe's father Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg and mother Rivka were killed by the terrorists.

text: Bollywood celebrities took to social media and paid tribute to Mumbai terror attack victims on the 10th anniversary. "Will never forget 26/11. We have only grown stronger," tweeted Varun Dhawan, while Arjun Kapoor wrote, "Remembering our heroes of 26/11. Everyone who helped each other through the tough time." "We lost 100s of humans...Please don't forget...or forgive," tweeted Koena Mitra.
summary: मुंबई आतंकी हमले के पीड़ितों को श्रद्धांजलि देते बॉलीवुड सेलेब्स

text: Actor Varun Dhawan has revealed that he went for the auditions of Kiran Rao's 2011 film 'Dhobi Ghat' but "didn't get the part". Talking about the same, Varun's father and filmmaker David Dhawan said, "I told him, are you mad that you are going to do a 'Dhobi Ghat'? You can not begin your career with such films."

text: After his match-winning figures of 4/36 in the third India-Australia T20I, Indian all-rounder, Krunal Pandya said that it took a while to back himself after registering figures of 0/55 in the first T20I. "When you come back like this, it is very satisfying. You had such a bad day and then against the same opponent you do well," Pandya added.
summary: 1 टी 20 आई: क्रुनाल में 0/55 के बाद खुद को वापस लेने के लिए कुछ समय लिया

text: While addressing a rally in Rajasthan's Bhilwara, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday asked the public at the rally if they ever saw him take a holiday. "Did you ever hear I went somewhere for leisure or was missing for a week?" he added. He said he has given account of each and every decision he has taken.
summary: क्या आपने कभी सुना कि मैंने छुट्टी ली: राजस्थान में पी.एम.

text: Australia's former captain Ian Chappell said the Australian team's efforts to temper their on-field behaviour might lead to a reduction in verbal sledging but will not result in a reduction in short-pitched deliveries. Chappell added that the Australian team should not be underestimated as the absence of Steve Smith and David Warner will make the Australian bowlers more determined.
summary: ऑस्ट्रेलिया से कम क्रिया लेकिन अधिक बाउंसर: इयान चैपल

text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday claimed that Congress leaders are ashamed of saying "Bharat Mata Ki Jai". While addressing a rally in poll-bound Madhya Pradesh, he also asked the opposition party to give details of its performance when it was in power. He further lauded the state government for bringing huge reforms in the agriculture sector.
summary: कांग्रेसी नेताओं को 'भारत माता की जय' कहने में शर्म आती है: शाह

text: Indian spinner Kuldeep Yadav jumped 20 places to reach the third spot in the ICC T20I bowler rankings after his performances in the recently-concluded T20I series against Australia. Meanwhile, Australian leg-spinner Adam Zampa made a 17-spot leap to reach the fifth spot after picking up three wickets against India across two bowling innings in the series.
summary: कुलदीप 20 स्थानों की छलांग लगाकर टी 20 आई रैंकिंग में तीसरे स्थान पर पहुंच गए

text: The International Cricket Council has pitched for the inclusion of Women's T20I cricket as an event at the Commonwealth Games 2022, set to be held in England's Birmingham. "We would like cricket to lead the way in the Commonwealth in inspiring more young girls to take up sport regardless of their background or culture," ICC CEO David Richardson said.
summary: बर्मिंघम कॉमनवेल्थ गेम्स में महिला T20I के लिए ICC की पिच

text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton, who had claimed his fifth world championship in October, won the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. Hamilton finished ahead of Ferrari's German driver Sebastian Vettel with Red Bull's Dutch driver Max Verstappen finishing at the third place. Two-time F1 champion, Spain's Fernando Alonso finished 11th in his farewell Grand Prix.
summary: लुईस हैमिल्टन ने अबू धाबी ग्रांड प्रिक्स के सीजन-सी में जीत हासिल की

text: Following the appointment of Sumer Juneja as its India head, SoftBank is planning to make investments in the country's foodtech space. SoftBank would also be looking to make investments in Indian startups across sectors including clean energy, logistics, and e-commerce. Further, SoftBank Investment Advisers, which invests through SoftBank Vision Fund, is also opening an office in Mumbai.
summary: सॉफ्टबैंक ने भारत के फूडटेक स्पेस में निवेश किया

text: US and Mumbai-based smart wearable startup GOQii has raised $30-35 million funding led by Japan's Mitsui & Co. New investors Galaxy Digital and Denlow Investment Trust also participated in the round along with existing investors including Paytm's Vijay Shekhar Sharma and Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. With the latest fundraising, GOQii could be valued at around $100-125 million.
summary: स्मार्ट पहनने योग्य स्टार्टअप GOQii मित्सुई एंड कंपनी के नेतृत्व में $ 30mn बढ़ाता है

text: A flaw in NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter's data has ruled out some signs of water on Mars, according to a study. According to the researchers, the Orbiter's imaging spectrometer can be confused by some high-contrast areas, and produce false signs of perchlorates that hintn at salt water flows. "We have to be more cautious about detecting them," researchers added.

text: BJP MP Subramanian Swamy on Monday said people from Pakistan shouldn't be allowed on Kartarpur corridor that will link Punjab's Gurdaspur to Gurdwara Darbar Sahib Kartarpur. India and Pakistan agreed to the corridor ahead of Guru Nanak's 550th birth anniversary next year.

text: Police on Monday said eight Naxals and two police personnel were killed in an encounter between ultras and security men in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district. text: At least 22 policemen have been killed in a Taliban attack on a security forces' convoy in Afghanistan's western Farah province. text: Researchers in the US have developed a system called 'BrainGate2' that lets people with neurologic disease or limb loss communicate with unmodified computer tablets. It lets people with neurologic disease perform tasks like texting or streaming music.

text: A total of 32 wickets fell on the second and third day of the first Test between Bangladesh and the Windies. Bangladesh took a 1-0 lead in the series with a 64-run win on the third day. text: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan surpassed legendary English cricketer Ian Botham to become the fastest cricketer in the history of Test cricket to complete the double of 200 wickets and 3,000 runs. Shakib achieved this feat in his 54th Test, one less than Botham's long-standing record of 55. Shakib picked a combined total of five wickets in the Bangladesh-Windies Test.
summary: B'desh ने सबसे तेज़ 200 विकेट लिए, 3,000 रन टेस्ट डबल

text: Spanish club Real Madrid have denied their captain, Sergio Ramos failed a doping test after the 2017-18 Champions League final. The allegations had been made against Ramos by German magazine Der Spiegel in a 'Football Leaks' revelation. UEFA also released a statement, saying it "strongly and categorically refutes unfounded allegations it has covered up positive doping results."

text: Facebook is planning to train five million people with digital skills by 2021 in India, the company's Public Policy Director, India, Ankhi Das said on Saturday. "Facebook is committed to enabling small businesses to reach global economy," she further said. Facebook has already trained about one million people through ten ongoing initiatives across 150 cities and 48,000 villages, she added.

text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was allegedly attacked with chilli powder, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said Kejriwal "engineered the fake attack...so he could create an atmosphere of public hatred against me and get me killed in a mob attack." text: Astronomers at Hawaii's Keck Observatory claim to have detected water in the atmosphere of a planet 129 light-years away from the Earth. The discovery was made while studying a young giant gas planet called HR 8799c, which is about 7 times the mass of Jupiter and has a radius that is 20% larger, the astronomers said.

text: A study led by scientists from Harvard and Yale University has proposed spraying Sun-dimming chemicals into the Earth's atmosphere to cut the rate of global warming by half. The chemicals could be sprayed using high-altitude aircraft, it added.

text: India's Mary Kom has become the first ever boxer to win six AIBA Women's World Boxing Championship titles. According to preliminary reports, at least five school children were travelling on the bus.

text: Model Kate Sharma, who accused filmmaker Subhash Ghai of forcibly trying to kiss her, has withdrawn her case against him as she wants to take care of her ill mother and family. text: Noida-based sculptor Ram Sutar, who designed the world's tallest statue, the 600-foot Statue of Unity in Gujarat, has been roped in for an 80-foot Buddha statue in capital Gandhinagar by a Buddhist non-profit body Sanghakaya Foundation. The 93-year-old Padma Bhushan awardee has also completed designing a 400-foot Shivaji statue and a 250-foot Ambedkar statue, to be installed in Mumbai.

text: Delhi Police have arrested a 32-year-old man for allegedly killing his 38-year-old wife and injuring his 18-month-old and teenaged step-daughters after running his truck over them when he was drunk. text: A 24-year-old Ghaziabad resident named Shankar died and his 17-year-old cousin Deepak was injured after the motorcycle they were on skidded before hitting a road divider at Delhi's Signature Bridge on Saturday morning. text: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has said that the terror attack on the Chinese consulate in Karachi was "a reaction to the unprecedented trade agreements" signed between the two countries earlier this month. The attack was intended to scare Chinese investors and undermine the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor project, Khan wrote on Twitter. Two Pakistani civilians were killed in the attack.

text: The market value of all cryptocurrencies has plunged $700 billion from about $835 billion at the market peak in January, according to CoinMarketCap.com. The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell to a near 14-month low of around $4,200 on Friday.

text: The heads of state-run banks can now request look-out circulars to be issued against wilful defaulters and prevent them from fleeing India. text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has said that service charge collected by restaurants but not passed on to workers will be liable to income tax. The CBDT's crackdown comes after the Consumer Affairs Ministry flagged its concerns.

text: Comparing Kartarpur corridor to the Berlin Wall which separated East and West Germany from 1961 to 1989, PM Narendra Modi said, "Had anyone ever thought the Berlin Wall would fall." text: Criticising captain Harmanpreet Kaur's decision to not play Mithali Raj in the Women's World T20 semi-final against England, Mithali's manager Annisha Gupta termed Kaur a "shameless, manipulative, lying, immature, and undeserving captain." text: Four friends aged between 17 and 24 died after they allegedly jumped before a moving train in a suspected suicide pact in Rajasthan's Alwar, police said. text: The Kerala government on Friday told the High Court that two days can be kept exclusively for women devotees to pray at Sabarimala temple in order to implement the Supreme Court's order allowing entry to women of all ages. text: The Centre on Thursday appointed Vijay Kumar Dev, a 1987-batch IAS officer, as the Chief Secretary of Delhi. text: Taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Raj Babbar on Thursday said, "The Indian rupee has fallen so much against the dollar that it is nearing your beloved mother's age." text: Akula Hanumanth, an independent candidate from Telangana's Koratla constituency, is distributing slippers to voters and saying, "If I don't work after winning, you can hit me with the slipper." His campaign video has gone viral with people asking other politicians to follow the suit. Koratla seat is represented by Telangana Rashtra Samithi's senior leader and MLA K Vidyasagar Rao.
summary: अगर मैं काम नहीं करता तो मुझे मारो: मतदाता को मतदाताओं को चप्पल देना

text: Goa Forward Party chief and Agriculture Minister Vijai Sardesai has claimed that ailing CM Manohar Parrikar wanted to resign, but the BJP high command vetoed it. "He had even shown inclination to give away his portfolios when he was admitted during Ganesh Chaturthi festival," added Sardesai. Parrikar is recuperating at his residence since his discharge from AIIMS on October 14.
summary: सीएम पर्रिकर छोड़ना चाहते थे, बीजेपी ने अनुमति नहीं दी: गोवा के मंत्री

text: Japanese carmaker Nissan reportedly provided Carlos Ghosn, who was ousted as Chairman on Thursday, with six houses, including residences in Tokyo and New York. Reports had earlier said Ghosn got company-funded properties in cities such as Beirut, Rio de Janeiro, Paris and Amsterdam. Ghosn's elder sister was paid $100,000 a year as remuneration for a non-existent "advisory role", reports added.
summary: निसान ने 6 देशों में 6 घरों के साथ पूर्व अध्यक्ष प्रदान किया: रिपोर्ट

text: Two bikers were killed after falling 25-30 feet from Delhi's Signature Bridge that was inaugurated on November 4. Reports suggested the men tried to perform stunts when they lost control of the bike. The police, however, said no witness has come forward to verify the reports, adding the bikers fell on hitting a divider while "speeding and taking a turn".
summary: दिल्ली के Bridge Sign € ™ सिग्नेचर ब्रिज से 30 फीट गिरने के बाद दो बाइकर्स की मौत

text: India's decision to build the Kartarpur corridor is "a step towards (the) right direction", Pakistan's Minister for Information and Broadcasting Chaudhry Fawad Hussain has said. He further referred to India's decision as a "victory of peace lobby in both (the) countries". "(W)e hope such steps will encourage voice of reason and tranquillity on both sides of the border," he added.
summary: सही दिशा में करतारपुर का निर्णय: भारत के संबंधों पर पाक

text: CM Chandrababu Naidu has nearly finalised the design for Andhra Pradesh's 250-metre-high assembly building that would make it taller than the world's tallest statue, Gujarat's 'Statue of Unity', by 68 metres. The proposed structure is shaped like an upside-down lily flower consisting of three floors, and the state expects the tendering process to take two years, minister P Narayana said.
summary: आंध्र की विधानसभा दुनिया की सबसे ऊंची प्रतिमा से ऊंची होगी: सीएम

text: Hundreds of students protested at SRM University near Chennai on Thursday night after a male worker allegedly masturbated in front of an undergraduate student in the lift. Protestors alleged the hostel warden blamed the girl's clothes and asked her not to reveal the incident. College authorities said the worker was fired while police stated no complaint was filed till Thursday.
summary: SRM विश्वविद्यालय कार्यकर्ता छात्र पर हस्तमैथुन करता है, वार्डन कपड़े फाड़ता है

text: At least six Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed in an ongoing encounter between terrorists and security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district on Friday, the J&K Police said. Arms and ammunition, including six rifles, were recovered from the site. Meanwhile, as a precautionary measure, mobile internet services were suspended in Anantnag.
summary: जम्मू-कश्मीर के अनंतनाग में मुठभेड़ में लश्कर के छह आतंकी मारे गए

text: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney became a British citizen on Wednesday, fulfilling a promise made when he accepted the job in 2012. The 53-year-old Canadian central banker, who is married to British economist Diana Fox, already had an Irish passport. The first foreign Governor in Bank of England's 300-year history, Carney is due to step down in January 2020.
summary: ब्रिटेन का नागरिक बनकर बैंक ऑफ इंग्लैंड के गवर्नर ने वादा पूरा किया

text: The seat occupancy of airlines in India, the world's fastest-growing aviation market, fell to its lowest in 19 months because of excess supply, according to data released by DGCA. The average passenger load factor, or the percentage of seats filled, fell to 83% in October. India's domestic air passenger growth also slowed to 13%, the slowest pace in 15 months.
summary: भारतीय एयरलाइंस 19 महीनों में सबसे अधिक खाली सीटें उड़ाती हैं

text: Denise Coates, the billionaire founder and co-CEO of UK gambling firm Bet365, paid herself a salary of ÃÂ£220 million (Ã¢ÂÂ¹2,000 crore) last fiscal. The 51-year-old also collected dividend payments of ÃÂ£45 million (Ã¢ÂÂ¹410 crore) from her shareholding of over 50% in Bet365. Her pay is more than double of what is paid to the entire Bet365-owned Stoke City football team.
summary: जुआ फर्म के अरबपति संस्थापक खुद को ¢ salary2,000 करोड़ वेतन का भुगतान करते हैं

text: Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas will host two wedding receptions, one in Delhi and another in Mumbai, as per reports. The pre-wedding festivities including sangeet and mehendi ceremonies will begin on November 29 followed by their wedding as per Hindu rituals on December 2 and a Christian wedding on December 3, reports suggested. The wedding will take place in Jodhpur.
summary: प्रियंका, निक दो रिसेप्शन पोस्ट शादी की मेजबानी करने के लिए: रिपोर्ट

text: Janhvi Kapoor, while talking about her late mother and actress Sridevi, said that she cannot emulate her even if she wanted to. "This year brought me both the worst and the best experience of my life. It's a little strange...Our family is now united, so that's very big thing for me. But, whatever nhappened was too heavy," added Janhvi.
summary: मैं उसका अनुकरण नहीं कर सकता, भले ही मैं चाहता था: श्रीदेवी को जान्हवी

text: The teaser trailer of Disney's upcoming live-action film 'The Lion King' has been released. Directed by Jon Favreau, 'The Lion King' is the remake of the 1994 animated film by the same name. The film, starring Donald Glover, Seth Rogen, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Billy Eichner, John Oliver, Keegan-Michael Key, and BeyoncÃÂ© Knowles-Carter, is scheduled to release on July 19, 2019.
summary: डिज़्नी की 'द लायन किंग' का टीज़र ट्रेलर रिलीज़ हुआ

text: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he was "going through a professional high" when suddenly his wife Tahira Kashyap was diagnosed with breast cancer. "It was very difficult. I have realised that life is never perfect...So, this was just a small imperfection according to us. We are taking it as it is," he added. Tahira had revealed about cancer on Instagram.
summary: जब मैं पेशेवर उच्च आयु में था तब पत्नी के कैंसर का पता चला: आयुष्मान

text: Shahid Kapoor and his half-brother Ishaan Khatter will appear together on the sixth season of talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. Sharing a picture with them, Karan Johar wrote, "Brothers in arms!" Janhvi Kapoor along with her half-brother Arjun Kapoor, and Ayushmann Khurrana together with Vicky Kaushal, will also be appearing on the show.
summary: 'कॉफी विद करण 6' में साथ दिखेंगे शाहिद, ईशान

text: Ayushmann Khurrana has said he feels validated as an actor who chose to do good cinema. "I still remember most people in the industry warning me that I was not playing the stardom game and that I was becoming niche because these content films don't do big numbers," he added. Ayushmann further said the journey has only started for him.
summary: उस अभिनेता के रूप में मान्य महसूस करें जिसने अच्छा सिनेमा करना चुना: आयुष्मान

text: The Rajasthan BJP on Thursday said it expelled 11 leaders, including four ministers, for six years for contesting against party candidates in the upcoming Assembly elections. Meanwhile, several BJP leaders shifted camps after the candidates' list was announced. Rajasthan will witness polls on December 7 and the results will be declared on December 11.
summary: राजस्थान बीजेपी ने 4 मंत्रियों सहित 11 बागी नेताओं को निष्कासित कर दिया

text: After J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik dissolved the state Assembly, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said, "It was a decision taken by the governor. The BJP has no role. It is unfortunate that some section is trying to drag BJP into this." PDP had staked claim to form the government with support from NC and Congress but the Assembly was dissolved.
summary: जम्मू-कश्मीर विधानसभा भंग करने में भाजपा की कोई भूमिका नहीं है: राजनाथ सिंह

text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Thursday announced that a special Assembly session will be held on Monday to discuss the alleged chilli powder attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal and the Centre and Delhi Police's stand in the matter. He added, "The deletion of 30 lakh voters in Delhi, done by BJP along with the EC, will also be discussed." n
summary: केजरीवाल हमले पर चर्चा के लिए दिल्ली सरकार ने विशेष सत्र आयोजित किया

text: Jet Airways on Thursday announced former Foreign Secretary Ranjan Mathai's resignation as independent director. "I am no longer able to devote the time required to meet my obligations," Mathai said. Vikram Mehta's resignation as independent director was announced on November 9, citing similar reasons. This comes amid reports that the Centre sought Tata Sons' help to rescue the debt-ridden airline.
summary: रंजन मथाई जेट एयरवेज बोर्ड को छोड़ देते हैं, 2 सप्ताह में दूसरा पद छोड़ देते हैं

text: India crashed out of 2018 Women's World T20 after suffering an 8-wicket defeat in their semi-final match against England in Antigua today. England, who had won the inaugural edition of Women's World T20 in 2009, have reached the final of the tournament for the fourth time. They will face three-time champions Australia in the final on Sunday.
summary: भारत इंग्लैंड से सेमीफाइनल हार के बाद महिला डब्ल्यूटी 20 से बाहर हो गया

text: A Satanic group which sued Netflix and Warner Bros for $50 million over the series 'Chilling Adventures of Sabrina' has "amicably" settled the lawsuit. The Satanic Temple claimed the entertainment giants copied its depiction of goat-headed deity Baphomet. The group's leader said "the unique elements of the Satanic Temple's Baphomet statue" have been acknowledged in the credits of the show.
summary: शैतानवादियों ने बकरी की मूर्ति के ऊपर $ 50 मिलियन नेटफ्लिक्स का मुकदमा चलाया

text: Former Censor Board chief Pahlaj Nihalani's upcoming film 'Rangeela Raja', starring Govinda, has dialogues referring to a woman as 'kadak ghevar' (a sweet), and rape as 'swadishth khana' (delicious food). The Censor Board in its affidavit to the Bombay HC demanded 20 cuts in the film including these dialogues. "The film glorifies violence and objectifies women," the Censor Board said.
summary: पह्लज फिल्म ने महिला को ad कड़क घेवर ’और बलात्कार को k स्वदिष्ट खाना’ कहा है।

text: Actor Salman Khan, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju and Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu were seen cycling in the state's Mechuka on Thursday. "It was an exhilarating experience to be part of 10km bicycle ride with Bollywood Superstar Salman Khan...Thanks with all my heart to @BeingSalmanKhan for his presence at Mechuka Adventure Festival," CM Khandu tweeted.
summary: सलमान खान ने केंद्रीय मंत्री रिजिजू, अरुणाचल के सीएम खांडू के साथ साइकिल चलाई

text: After journalist Piers Morgan criticised female musicians group 'Little Mix' for posing naked, American singer Ariana Grande slammed him and shared a picture of him in which he posed nearly naked. "I use my talent AND my sexuality all the time because I choose to," tweeted Grande. "Women can be sexual AND talented...naked and dignified...It's OUR choice," she added.
summary: जर्दन नग्नता के लिए महिलाओं को पटकती है, ग्रांडे अपने लगभग नग्न चित्र साझा करती है

text: Replying to a troll who questioned his record in Australia following his tweet on big boundaries there, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin wrote, "I can't Google you and find you." "2 for 26, 1 for 27 and 1 for 37 in the 3-0 win last series. Thanks buddy," replied Ashwin to another troll who said he was hit for sixes in Australia.
summary: आपको Google पर नहीं मिल सकता है: अश्विन को ट्रोल करने के लिए जिन्होंने उनके रिकॉर्ड पर सवाल उठाया था

text: Cricket Australia released a special video to reveal the 14-member Australian squad for the first two Test matches against India. The names of the players were revealed one by one in graphic form, set against the backdrop of a backyard cricket match. Captain Tim Paine's name was displayed on bread slices, while batsman Shaun Marsh's name appeared on the pitch.
summary: ऑस्ट्रेलिया के दस्ते ने पहले 2 भारत टेस्ट के लिए विशेष वीडियो का इस्तेमाल किया
